title: Chapter 420
content: # Chapter 420 The mountain couldn't withstand the force. Transcended Link detonated like a bomb, and the entire slope gave way. Rubble poured down in a lethal hail. The Russians moved. Third advancement classes, all of them. They had the control to read Transcended Link's trajectory, the skill depth to counter Linked Kill Wave's pattern. Stone shattered against hastily raised guards. Bodies twisted midair. They hit the ground hard but rolled through the impact, already repositioning. Not one of them took a killing blow. *Different breed,* Grid noted. The two second advancement users earlier had folded like paper. These four were another matter entirely. Alexander, ranked 22nd, caught his attention. The military student wore small shields on both wrists. When Linked Kill Wave crashed into him, he crossed his arms and the shields flared. The aura blade shattered against them like glass on steel. Not a tanker class. Some kind of technique negation. "You're a monster, I'll give you that." Alexander flexed his hands, working feeling back into numbed fingers. "Pure skill power? You might edge out Kraugel." He paused. "Everything else? You're below me." Alexander had been at last year's National Competition. He'd watched Grid dismantle Hurent, then Bondre, then claim the entire PvP bracket. It had stung. The realization that he couldn't beat this outsider had scraped against his pride like a knife. But a year changed things. "I advanced faster than most." Alexander rolled his shoulders. "You got stronger. I got stronger *more*." Grid tilted his head slightly. "I trained in the East Continent," Alexander continued. "Cleared fifteen islands in the Behen Archipelago. Hit Fog Island on a lucky roll and bought every elixir I could carry. Spent six months in the East grinding quest chains you've never heard of." He cracked his knuckles. "I've got four hundred stat points over anyone else at my level. My aura hardens into offense and defense simultaneously. Think a yellow monkey like you can handle that?" Grid laughed. Alexander's expression darkened. "Something funny?" "In my experience, the ones who talk this much usually die in one hit." Grid shifted his weight, stance loose. "I'm just wondering how many seconds you'll last." It was blatant bait. Grid had read Alexander's temper in the first exchange and was dangling the hook. Alexander, surprisingly, didn't bite. "Listen, monkey." His voice stayed level. "You've been winning for a while. Feels good, I bet. But let me explain reality." The world was vast. Two billion users played Satisfy. "Why do you think only a handful of rankers show up to these competitions?" Alexander spread his hands. "You're strong. But there are thousands like you that the public has never seen." The real monsters, the ones at Kraugel's level or beyond, they stayed hidden. They didn't need the exposure. "They're not hungry anymore," Alexander said. "No unfulfilled ambitions worth revealing their cards. They're *complete*. Already at the peak." "Your point?" Grid asked. "The rankers in this competition? We're all B-class. Incomplete. Weak enough to need the validation of going public." Alexander's lips curled. "So don't get cocky just because you beat a few of us." "Huh." Grid considered that. The logic held water. He'd had reasons for entering the competition. Recognition. Adamantium. Promoting Overgeared. If he'd had none of those needs, he probably wouldn't have bothered. Faker hadn't shown up two years running. Grid nodded slowly. "So Alexander, by your own ranking, you're B-class too. Thanks for the heads up before I put you down." Alexander snorted. "Wrong. I'm A-class." He was strong enough that competing was suboptimal. Exposing his capabilities was a tactical error. But he'd entered anyway. "For my country's glory," Alexander said. "Now you get to experience A-class power. Be the foundation Russia stands on." Grid's eyes widened. The ground beneath his feet erupted. Thorns of solidified aura burst upward, jagged and fast. Grid's Insight stat flared. The Slaughterer's Eye Patch fed him data. He read the ground's distortion a split second before the eruption and *moved*. His agility had jumped thirty percent during his time in the Behen Archipelago. His body responded like water, flowing between the thorns before they could skewer him. Alexander's eyes tracked the movement, wider than he'd expected. *There it is. Items, stats, skills. The trinity.* He linked his next skill while the thought finished. "Useless! Aura Explosion!" The thorns hardened further, then detonated. Shrapnel and concussive force hammered into Grid's position. > [You have dealt 680 damage to the target.] > > [You have dealt 599 damage to the target.] > > [You have dealt 605 damage to the target.] "What?" Alexander's confidence cracked. The damage was a fraction of what it should have been. Had Grid somehow gotten outside the blast radius? The dust cleared. No. Grid had tanked it. His defense was *absurd*. *Overgeared.* The word surfaced from memory. Grid's first public appearance, facing down a Yatan Servant with nothing but superior equipment and the audacity to name himself after it. *But even the best armor breaks eventually.* Alexander closed the distance. His twin swords screamed through the air, both edges aimed at Grid's throat. Without flight magic, most fighters would've been pinned. Grid had spent two years with Fly active. He moved through three dimensions now as naturally as walking. He brought his greatsword up, angled to catch both strikes. **CLANG. CLANG. CLANG.** "How?" Grid was using a greatsword. The attack speed should have been glacial. Instead, it was splitting the difference between a longsword and a heavy blade. Fast enough to be unpredictable. Heavy enough that each block rattled Alexander's bones. The weight transfer was wrong, too. Alexander barely raised his shield in time. The greatsword crashed into it like a siege hammer. His feet left the ground. He slammed into the earth ten meters away, the impact driving the air from his lungs. Grid dove after him. "Pagma's Swordsmanship." Mid-air, no leverage, he activated Link. **Shink. Shink-shink-shink-shink.** The greatsword blurred. Thirty black streaks materialized around Alexander's body, each one a compressed slash waiting to detonate. Grid expected the pattern. Alexander would try to create distance, use the terrain. But Alexander was better than that. Aura erupted from his body in a spiral. It formed a hardened shell, a tornado of compressed energy that solidified into a barrier. The instant Grid's Link made contact, it shattered. **CRACK-CRACK-CRACK-CRACK.** Hundreds of aura fragments scattered like shrapnel. Through the glittering debris, Grid and Alexander locked eyes. Alexander grinned. "Louder than before! Aura Explosion!" Every fragment detonated simultaneously. **BOOM.** Grid grunted. His first sound of actual pain since the event started. Dozens of point-blank explosions, no way to avoid the damage. "*That's* A-class power!" Alexander surged forward. Left hand drove into Grid's sternum. Right hand angled the sword up, punching through Grid's guard toward his abdomen. Not weak strikes. Real commitment behind both. But Grid's equipment was on another level. > [The Largest Gloves have reduced physical damage by 4%.] > > [The Shiny Gauntlets have reduced physical damage by 5%.] > > [The Heavy Helmet has reduced physical damage by 6%.] > > [Lantier's Cloak has reduced the damage of all stabbing and cutting attacks by 20%.] > > [Triple Layers has reduced physical damage by 4%.] > > [Triple Layers has reduced the damage of stabbing attacks by 50%.] > > [The enemy's sword is caught in the gap of Triple Layers. The skill 'Sword Breaker' is used.] > > [The target's weapon durability has dropped.] **SCREECH.** Alexander's sword caught in the layered scales of Grid's armor. The blade bent. Durability plummeted. His face went white. "What?" It was like attacking a named golem boss. Not a player. Not a person wearing armor. A walking siege fortification. Grid met his eyes. "If you're A-class, what does that make me? S-class?" *These damn items.* Alexander ripped his sword free and reset. His strongest skill. Exceed Sword. Every ounce of his hardened aura concentrated at the blade's point. It had defense penetration. It was made for exactly this scenario. He thrust. Grid didn't dodge. Didn't try. The skill was too fast, and dodging would burn stamina he might need later. He just stood there and trusted his equipment. The Heavy Helmet. The Largest Gloves. The Shiny Gauntlets. Triple Layers. Lantier's Cloak. They paid back his faith in full. > [You have suffered 8,144 damage.] "You're joking." His strongest skill. Eight thousand damage. And his sword's durability dropped *again*. Grid's greatsword came around in a tight arc. Alexander tried to retreat, but Grid had activated the skill mid-swing. No time. No space. Linked Kill punched through Alexander's aura guard and found his heart. **Thud.** **Thud-thud-thud.** Alexander hardened his aura shield in desperation. It worked. The first strike of Linked Kill broke against it. But Linked Kill struck a minimum of three times. Grid rolled high. Six impacts. The second strike cracked the shield. The third shattered it. Four through six opened Alexander from sternum to pelvis. He became gray light and pixels. Silence. The Russian representatives stared. They'd expected Alexander to crush Grid. He was the second strongest after Kraugel. The result should have been a foregone conclusion. It had been. Just not in the direction they'd anticipated. Grid turned to face them. "Still think I'm a dog?" The Russian representatives shook their heads. --- **Glossary of Common Korean Terms.** **OG: Glossary Link.** Current schedule: 20 chapters a week.
